derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from Old French formatif, -ive or medieval Latin formativus, from Latin formare 'to form' (see form)

entry.tran: (时期或经历)决定性格的，影响发展的
entry.def: A formative period of time or experience is one that has an important and lasting influence on a person's character and attitudes.

example.ex: She was born in Barbados but spent her formative years in east London.
example.tran: 她出生于巴巴多斯，但是其性格形成的关键期是在伦敦东区度过的。

means.word_mean: 1. minimal language unit that has a syntactic (or morphological) function
1. relating to or characterized by formative effects or formation;
2. susceptible to alteration by development and experience;
4. capable of forming new cells and tissues;
5. forming or capable of forming or molding;
